intro: Leucopogon ovatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant is part of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and it is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils. It plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators. Leucopogon ovatus is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
